1538407463_14ytAKDfNjArMTqGecTi7ginG3aZT.body:
I am interested in IPFS, but I fear it wouldn't work with ZeroNet as it doesn't offer privacy and is adviced to not be used with Tor.

* https://privacytools.io/ lists IPFS and links to privacy warning: https://github.com/privacytoolsIO/privacytools.io/pull/361#issuecomment-344414022
* https://discuss.ipfs.io/t/implications-of-running-ipfs-companion-with-tor-browser/3905/3

1538505571_15hL2gR4oCSgKBbndn3MxY8Hc5xoy.body:
> I'm up for trying this but public hyperboria peers are shit

Finding public peers was a pain for me too but, finally I found https://lvlts.github.io/hyperboria-peer-check/ and http://cjdns.cupivan.ru/ and could stop trying to use offline peers. It also helped me to find `tools/peerStats` and realize that my VPS can route/switch traffic regardless of not being able to connect or be connected from there, so I hope I might be starting to peer with people without public peers.

1550688425_1Axcs3zkrrpHhBAAZMUhXEQZ4z6ah.body:
I would say that I2P is Tor without exit nodes and there everyone is always a relay and they encourage traffic like torrenting while Tor network gets drained by that. They also don't have directory/bridge/whatever authorities which Tor depends on.

Cjdns is not anonymous, your peers still know who you really are and AFAIK they don't support Tor peers, while Yggdrasil can work over Tor and I2P, but those are discouraged and may also deanonymize you.

1550540672_19ynt2naJSvRqWrGvAbVufPafr86C.body:
I wonder what is the status with Tor's Snowflake support, that seems difficult to censorship, but may only be supported by Tor Browser.

https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/wiki/doc/Snowflake

1557064345_1GqfwGz2U6QVTSE4LxuudaJcnap92.body: Do you have backup of `data/users.json` ? If you do and restore it, your old name should return.

1557421253_191qyhaRxXEx1bdtG65iQvFddtXBj.body: There is another issue in allowing 127.0.0.1 in Tor Browser, you can possibly be fingerprinted based on what ports you have open. https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/Documentation/issues/84
